text.text_translated: In 2010, NASA had a team. This team worked to keep Earth safe. They found and listed 90 out of 100 of the space rocks. These space rocks were 1 kilometre wide. They were near Earth. We call these 'near-Earth objects' (NEOs). NEOs are as big as mountains. They can be 50 million kilometres from Earth's path. NASA knows about 887 of these NEOs. They still need to list 50 more. NASA says these known NEOs are not a danger to Earth.

feedback.feedback: PASS: The text successfully adheres to all A2 readability standards and diagnostic protocols. Factual integrity is maintained, and both MeaningBERT (0.8145) and BERTScore (0.9118) metrics are well within the required thresholds, indicating excellent preservation of meaning and fidelity to the original content. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. The vocabulary is appropriately simplified, using A1/A2 words like 'space rocks' for 'asteroids' and 'Earth's path' for 'Earth's orbit'. Sentence structures are consistently short and simple, and connectors are limited to A2-appropriate usage ('and'). No deviations from the A2 standard were detected.

best_attempt.text_translated: In 2010, NASA had a team. This team worked to keep Earth safe. They found and listed 90 out of 100 of the space rocks. These space rocks were 1 kilometre wide. They were near Earth. We call these 'near-Earth objects' (NEOs). NEOs are as big as mountains. They can be 50 million kilometres from Earth's path. NASA knows about 887 of these NEOs. They still need to list 50 more. NASA says these known NEOs are not a danger to Earth.
